content: How can I help you today?

I've just been having a really hard time sleeping. My mind won't stop racing, especially at night, and I'm struggling to figure out how to deal with everything. Work has been super stressful, and I'm just feeling so overwhelmed.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot on your shoulders right now, with work stress and your racing thoughts at night making sleep difficult. Feeling overwhelmed can make it even harder to sort through things. What’s been weighing on your mind the most?

I'm really worried about losing my job. Things at work have been tense, and with the way the economy is right now, I feel like I'd be one of the first to go if they start cutting people. I keep thinking about how I’d support my family if that happened, and it feels impossible to turn my brain off at night.

There's a lot of pressure there, balancing concerns about your job and responsibilities to your family. It sounds like you're working hard to stay ahead and protect what matters most to you, but that worry is keeping you from finding peace, especially at night. What would it mean to you if you felt more rested or had a clearer mind for dealing with this?

I guess if I could actually sleep, I’d feel less drained and maybe think more clearly about handling everything. But honestly, even if I could get rest, these problems aren’t going to go away, so it feels like I’m just stuck in this endless loop.

You're navigating something really hard, and it makes sense that feeling stuck might make sleep seem out of reach. Even though the challenges are still there, it sounds like you're recognizing how rest could give you some strength to approach them differently. What do you think might help you break out of that loop?

I’m honestly not sure what would help. I’ve tried things like scrolling on my phone until I’m too tired to keep my eyes open, but that doesn’t really work. I feel like even when I try to relax, the stress just creeps right back in.

It seems like you've been trying different ways to cope, even though they haven’t brought the relief you’re looking for. That shows you're trying to find solutions, even in the face of stress. Stress can be pretty persistent, and it sounds tough trying to keep it at bay. What do you think might be worth exploring, even if it’s a small step, to help calm your mind at night?

It’s tough because nothing seems to help for long. Maybe finding something different to focus on before bed would work, but honestly, I just don’t even know where to start. It feels like my mind doesn’t want to let go of the stress no matter what I try.

That constant pull of stress can feel like it takes over everything—especially when you're trying to wind down. Thinking about trying something different before bed shows openness to change, even if it feels uncertain right now. Would it help to explore ideas together for ways to shift your focus before bedtime?
Sure, let's give that a try. I'm open to ideas if you think they could help.

Thank you for being open to exploring this. Before we dive into ideas, is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to share about your current struggles? Sometimes talking more about what’s happening can help before brainstorming next steps.

I think I’ve already shared the big stuff—work stress, worrying about my family, and not being able to turn my mind off at night. I guess I do feel guilty sometimes, like I’m not doing enough as a parent or partner because I’m so stressed and tired all the time. Maybe that’s part of what’s weighing on me too.

That guilt you're feeling adds another layer to everything you're carrying, and it sounds like you're really invested in being there for your family despite how hard things have been for you. It shows a lot of care and responsibility. Would it be helpful to think about small ways to ease that stress and tiredness, so you can feel more present in the roles that matter most?

That guilt must be so heavy—it’s clear how much your family means to you, and you’re trying so hard to hold everything together. It’s okay to feel like this isn’t easy; you’re human, and it’s a lot to manage. Maybe we can think of ways to take some of that pressure off yourself, even in small moments, so you can feel more supported too. Does that sound like something that could help?

It sounds like the weight of everything might be crushing at times, but your care and effort for your family truly stand out. Thinking of ways to ease the pressure in small steps to refill your energy could help—you deserve that. How about we explore some manageable ideas together for shifting your focus or relaxing before bed?

I think that makes sense. Sometimes it’s the small steps that make the biggest difference, even though it feels hard to believe right now. What have you done in the past to relax or feel a little calmer, even if it wasn’t related to sleep? Maybe we can build on that together.

You’re absolutely right—small steps can feel meaningful, even when big changes seem far away. Reflecting on what’s helped you feel calmer before could be a great starting point. What’s something you’ve done in the past that made you feel even slightly more at ease?
I’m not sure, honestly. I guess I used to like going for walks or listening to music, but it’s been a while since I’ve done anything like that. Lately, I’ve just been too drained to even try.

It sounds like walks and music were things that used to bring you some calm, but stress has made it hard to reconnect with them. Feeling drained can make it tough to even imagine taking those first steps. What do you think about trying something small, maybe even starting with music, to ease into that space again?
